Events.html: 637 – Antioch surrenders to the Muslim forces under Rashidun Caliphate after the Battle of the Iron Bridge.
Events.text: Antioch surrenders to the Muslim forces under Rashidun Caliphate after the Battle of the Iron Bridge.

Events.html: 758 – Guangzhou is sacked by Arab and Persian pirates.
Events.text: Guangzhou is sacked by Arab and Persian pirates.

Events.html: 1137 – Battle of Rignano between Ranulf of Apulia and Roger II of Sicily.
Events.text: Battle of Rignano between Ranulf of Apulia and Roger II of Sicily.

Events.html: 1270 – The Eighth Crusade and siege of Tunis end by an agreement between Charles I of Sicily (brother to King Louis IX of France, who had died months earlier) and the sultan of Tunis.
Events.text: The Eighth Crusade and siege of Tunis end by an agreement between Charles I of Sicily (brother to King Louis IX of France, who had died months earlier) and the sultan of Tunis.

Events.html: 1340 – Portuguese and Castilian forces halt a Marinid invasion at the Battle of Río Salado.
Events.text: Portuguese and Castilian forces halt a Marinid invasion at the Battle of Río Salado.

Events.html: 1485 – King Henry VII of England is crowned.
Events.text: King Henry VII of England is crowned.

Events.html: 1501 – Ballet of Chestnuts: A banquet held by Cesare Borgia in the Papal Palace where fifty prostitutes or courtesans are in attendance for the entertainment of the guests.
Events.text: Ballet of Chestnuts: A banquet held by Cesare Borgia in the Papal Palace where fifty prostitutes or courtesans are in attendance for the entertainment of the guests.

Events.html: 1534 – English Parliament passes Act of Supremacy, making King Henry VIII head of the English church - a role formerly held by the Pope.
Events.text: English Parliament passes Act of Supremacy, making King Henry VIII head of the English church - a role formerly held by the Pope.

Events.html: 1657 – Spanish forces fail to retake Jamaica at the Battle of Ocho Rios during the Anglo-Spanish War.
Events.text: Spanish forces fail to retake Jamaica at the Battle of Ocho Rios during the Anglo-Spanish War.

Events.html: 1806 – Believing he is facing a much larger force, Prussian Lieutenant General Friedrich von Romberg, commanding 5,300 men, surrendered the city of Stettin to 800 French soldiers commanded by General Lassalle.
Events.text: Believing he is facing a much larger force, Prussian Lieutenant General Friedrich von Romberg, commanding 5,300 men, surrendered the city of Stettin to 800 French soldiers commanded by General Lassalle.

Events.html: 1817 – The independent government of Venezuela is established by Simón Bolívar.
Events.text: The independent government of Venezuela is established by Simón Bolívar.

Events.html: 1831 – In Southampton County, Virginia, escaped slave Nat Turner is captured and arrested for leading the bloodiest slave rebellion in United States history.
Events.text: In Southampton County, Virginia, escaped slave Nat Turner is captured and arrested for leading the bloodiest slave rebellion in United States history.

Events.html: 1863 – Danish Prince Vilhelm arrives in Athens to assume his throne as George I, King of the Hellenes.
Events.text: Danish Prince Vilhelm arrives in Athens to assume his throne as George I, King of the Hellenes.

Events.html: 1864 – Second Schleswig War ends. Denmark renounces all claim to Schleswig, Holstein and Lauenburg, which come under Prussian and Austrian administration.
Events.text: Second Schleswig War ends. Denmark renounces all claim to Schleswig, Holstein and Lauenburg, which come under Prussian and Austrian administration.

Events.html: 1864 – Helena, Montana is founded after four prospectors discover gold at "Last Chance Gulch".
Events.text: Helena, Montana is founded after four prospectors discover gold at "Last Chance Gulch".

Events.html: 1888 – Rudd Concession granted by King Lobengula of Matabeleland to agents of Cecil Rhodes led by Charles Rudd.
Events.text: Rudd Concession granted by King Lobengula of Matabeleland to agents of Cecil Rhodes led by Charles Rudd.

Events.html: 1894 – Domenico Melegatti obtains a patent for a procedure to be applied in producing pandoro industrially.
Events.text: Domenico Melegatti obtains a patent for a procedure to be applied in producing pandoro industrially.

Events.html: 1905 – Czar Nicholas II of Russia grants Russia's first constitution, creating a legislative assembly.
Events.text: Czar Nicholas II of Russia grants Russia's first constitution, creating a legislative assembly.

Events.html: 1918 – The Ottoman Empire signs an armistice with the Allies, ending the First World War in the Middle East.
Events.text: The Ottoman Empire signs an armistice with the Allies, ending the First World War in the Middle East.

Events.html: 1920 – The Communist Party of Australia is founded in Sydney.
Events.text: The Communist Party of Australia is founded in Sydney.

Events.html: 1922 – Benito Mussolini is made Prime Minister of Italy.
Events.text: Benito Mussolini is made Prime Minister of Italy.

Events.html: 1925 – John Logie Baird creates Britain's first television transmitter.
Events.text: John Logie Baird creates Britain's first television transmitter.

Events.html: 1929 – The Stuttgart Cable Car is constructed in Stuttgart, Germany.
Events.text: The Stuttgart Cable Car is constructed in Stuttgart, Germany.

Events.html: 1938 – Orson Welles broadcasts his radio play of H. G. Wells's The War of the Worlds, causing anxiety in some of the audience in the United States.
Events.text: Orson Welles broadcasts his radio play of H. G. Wells's The War of the Worlds, causing anxiety in some of the audience in the United States.

links.subject: The War of the Worlds
links.title: The War of the Worlds (radio drama)

Events.html: 1941 – World War II: Franklin Delano Roosevelt approves U.S. $1 billion in Lend-Lease aid to the Allied nations.
Events.text: World War II: Franklin Delano Roosevelt approves U.S. $1 billion in Lend-Lease aid to the Allied nations.

Events.html: 1941 – One thousand five hundred Jews from Pidhaytsi (in western Ukraine) are sent by Nazis to Bełżec extermination camp.
Events.text: One thousand five hundred Jews from Pidhaytsi (in western Ukraine) are sent by Nazis to Bełżec extermination camp.

Events.html: 1942 – Lt. Tony Fasson, Able Seaman Colin Grazier and canteen assistant Tommy Brown from HMS Petard board U-559, retrieving material which would lead to the decryption of the German Enigma code.
Events.text: Lt. Tony Fasson, Able Seaman Colin Grazier and canteen assistant Tommy Brown from HMS Petard board U-559, retrieving material which would lead to the decryption of the German Enigma code.

Events.html: 1944 – Anne Frank and sister Margot Frank are deported from Auschwitz to the Bergen-Belsen concentration camp.
Events.text: Anne Frank and sister Margot Frank are deported from Auschwitz to the Bergen-Belsen concentration camp.

Events.html: 1945 – Jackie Robinson of the Kansas City Monarchs signs a contract for the Brooklyn Dodgers to break the baseball color barrier.
Events.text: Jackie Robinson of the Kansas City Monarchs signs a contract for the Brooklyn Dodgers to break the baseball color barrier.

Events.html: 1947 – The General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade (GATT), which is the foundation of the World Trade Organisation (WTO), is founded.
Events.text: The General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade (GATT), which is the foundation of the World Trade Organisation (WTO), is founded.

links.subject: General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade
links.title: General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade

Events.html: 1950 – Pope Pius XII witnesses the "Miracle of the Sun" while at the Vatican.
Events.text: Pope Pius XII witnesses the "Miracle of the Sun" while at the Vatican.

Events.html: 1953 – Cold War: U.S. President Dwight D. Eisenhower formally approves the top secret document National Security Council Paper No. 162/2, which states that the United States' arsenal of nuclear weapons must be maintained and expanded to counter the communist threat.
Events.text: Cold War: U.S. President Dwight D. Eisenhower formally approves the top secret document National Security Council Paper No. 162/2, which states that the United States' arsenal of nuclear weapons must be maintained and expanded to counter the communist threat.

Events.html: 1960 – Michael Woodruff performs the first successful kidney transplant in the United Kingdom at the Edinburgh Royal Infirmary.
Events.text: Michael Woodruff performs the first successful kidney transplant in the United Kingdom at the Edinburgh Royal Infirmary.

Events.html: 1961 – Nuclear testing: The Soviet Union detonates the hydrogen bomb Tsar Bomba over Novaya Zemlya; at 50 megatons of yield, it remains the largest explosive device ever detonated, nuclear or otherwise.
Events.text: Nuclear testing: The Soviet Union detonates the hydrogen bomb Tsar Bomba over Novaya Zemlya; at 50 megatons of yield, it remains the largest explosive device ever detonated, nuclear or otherwise.

Events.html: 1961 – Because of "violations of Vladimir Lenin's precepts", it is decreed that Joseph Stalin's body be removed from its place of honour inside Lenin's tomb and buried near the Kremlin Wall with a plain granite marker instead.
Events.text: Because of "violations of Vladimir Lenin's precepts", it is decreed that Joseph Stalin's body be removed from its place of honour inside Lenin's tomb and buried near the Kremlin Wall with a plain granite marker instead.

Events.html: 1965 – English model Jean Shrimpton causes a global sensation by wearing a daring white minidress to Derby Day at Flemington Racecourse in Melbourne, Australia.
Events.text: English model Jean Shrimpton causes a global sensation by wearing a daring white minidress to Derby Day at Flemington Racecourse in Melbourne, Australia.

links.subject: a daring white minidress
links.title: White shift dress of Jean Shrimpton

Events.html: 1965 – Vietnam War: Near Da Nang, United States Marines repel an intense attack by Viet Cong forces, killing 56 guerrillas.
Events.text: Vietnam War: Near Da Nang, United States Marines repel an intense attack by Viet Cong forces, killing 56 guerrillas.

Events.html: 1970 – In Vietnam, the worst monsoon to hit the area in six years causes severe floods, kills 293, leaves 200,000 homeless and virtually halts the Vietnam War.
Events.text: In Vietnam, the worst monsoon to hit the area in six years causes severe floods, kills 293, leaves 200,000 homeless and virtually halts the Vietnam War.

Events.html: 1972 – A collision between two commuter trains in Chicago kills 45 and injures 332.
Events.text: A collision between two commuter trains in Chicago kills 45 and injures 332.

Events.html: 1973 – The Bosphorus Bridge in Istanbul, Turkey is completed, connecting the continents of Europe and Asia over the Bosphorus for the second time.
Events.text: The Bosphorus Bridge in Istanbul, Turkey is completed, connecting the continents of Europe and Asia over the Bosphorus for the second time.

Events.html: 1974 – The Rumble in the Jungle boxing match between Muhammad Ali and George Foreman takes place in Kinshasa, Zaire.
Events.text: The Rumble in the Jungle boxing match between Muhammad Ali and George Foreman takes place in Kinshasa, Zaire.

Events.html: 1974 – As a member of the California Angels, Major League Baseball player Nolan Ryan throws the fastest recorded pitch, at 100.9 miles per hour (162.4 kilometers per hour).
Events.text: As a member of the California Angels, Major League Baseball player Nolan Ryan throws the fastest recorded pitch, at 100.9 miles per hour (162.4 kilometers per hour).

Events.html: 1975 – Prince Juan Carlos becomes Spain's acting head of state, taking over for the country's ailing dictator, Gen. Francisco Franco.
Events.text: Prince Juan Carlos becomes Spain's acting head of state, taking over for the country's ailing dictator, Gen. Francisco Franco.

Events.html: 1980 – El Salvador and Honduras sign a peace treaty to put the border dispute fought over in 1969's Football War before the International Court of Justice.
Events.text: El Salvador and Honduras sign a peace treaty to put the border dispute fought over in 1969's Football War before the International Court of Justice.

Events.html: 1983 – The first democratic elections in Argentina after seven years of military rule are held.
Events.text: The first democratic elections in Argentina after seven years of military rule are held.

Events.html: 1985 – Space Shuttle Challenger lifts off for mission STS-61-A, its final successful mission.
Events.text: Space Shuttle Challenger lifts off for mission STS-61-A, its final successful mission.

Events.html: 1987 – In Japan, NEC releases the first 16-bit (fourth generation) video game console, the PC Engine, which is later sold in other markets under the name TurboGrafx-16.
Events.text: In Japan, NEC releases the first 16-bit (fourth generation) video game console, the PC Engine, which is later sold in other markets under the name TurboGrafx-16.

links.subject: 16-bit (fourth generation) video game console
links.title: History of video game consoles (fourth generation)

Events.html: 1991 – The Madrid Conference for Middle East peace talks opens.
Events.text: The Madrid Conference for Middle East peace talks opens.

Events.html: 1993 – The Troubles: The Ulster Defence Association, an Ulster loyalist paramilitary, carry out a mass shooting at a Halloween party in Greysteel, Northern Ireland. Eight civilians are murdered and thirteen wounded.
Events.text: The Troubles: The Ulster Defence Association, an Ulster loyalist paramilitary, carry out a mass shooting at a Halloween party in Greysteel, Northern Ireland. Eight civilians are murdered and thirteen wounded.

Events.html: 1995 – Quebec citizens narrowly vote (50.58% to 49.42%) to remain a province of Canada in their second referendum on national sovereignty.
Events.text: Quebec citizens narrowly vote (50.58% to 49.42%) to remain a province of Canada in their second referendum on national sovereignty.

Events.html: 2005 – The rebuilt Dresden Frauenkirche (destroyed in the firebombing of Dresden during World War II) is reconsecrated after a thirteen-year rebuilding project.
Events.text: The rebuilt Dresden Frauenkirche (destroyed in the firebombing of Dresden during World War II) is reconsecrated after a thirteen-year rebuilding project.

links.subject: firebombing of Dresden
links.title: Bombing of Dresden in World War II

Events.html: 2013 – 45 people die after a bus fuel tank catches fire in the Indian city of Mahbubnagar.
Events.text: 45 people die after a bus fuel tank catches fire in the Indian city of Mahbubnagar.

Events.html: 2014 – Sweden is the first European Union member state to officially recognize the State of Palestine.
Events.text: Sweden is the first European Union member state to officially recognize the State of Palestine.

links.subject: recognize
links.title: International recognition of the State of Palestine
